Intake of Officers.(a) 7,266 cadets are now undergoing training at Officer Cadet Training Units.\b) Since 3rd September, 1939, 3,849 officers have been commissioned fromOfficer Cadet Training Units.4. Intake of Other Ranks.(a) Between 29th February and 28th March, both inclusive, 23,000 menenlisted voluntarily bringing the total to 209,000 since 3rd September, 1939.(b) Army Class intake amounted to 56,000 during March, bringing the totalsince the inception of compulsory service to 320,000.5. Occupational training.By the allocation of a further 1,604 vacancies the total number of vacanciesallotted in courses for training tradesmen since the scheme started in October,1939, has been brought up to 8,632, of whom 825 have completed their training.6. Mobilization.On the one hand, mobilization orders were issued to 78 units: on the other,the liquidation of the Scandinavian projects involved the issue of orders for the disbandment of 39 units and formations and the reorganization of others. II. Equipment and Materiel.9. Supply of stone and ballast.Owing to the failure of existing organizations to supply the requirements ofthe British Expeditionary Force, arrangements have been made for Mr. Edlestonof the British Quarrying Company to visit France and advise on the stepsrequired to obtain supplies at the rate of 5,000 tons a week.III.
